oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Identifying barriers to successful dairy cow lameness management using stakeholder focus groups
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Wynands, E.
Ventura, B.
Roche, S.
Cramer, G.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: lameness
perceptions
management
animal welfare
cow longevity
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Lameness is a leading animal welfare concern in the dairy industry as it is painful and impacts cow longevity in the herd. Multiple stakeholders are involved in lameness management on a dairy farm including farmers, hoof trimmers, and veterinarians. The objective of this study was to explore perceptions of lameness and barriers to improved lameness management in these groups.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 2020; 382
